intro: Pelargonium pruinosum, commonly known as the velvet-leaf geranium, is a perennial shrub native to South Africa. It is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink, red, or white, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
